data.text: @ericcolsen @katiecouric Such a sad moment and shouldn’t have happened. His memory will live on for his beliefs. Rest In Peace Matt.

@ericcolsen @katiecouric @ericcolsen you have my ultimate respect and heart as well as to @katiecouric for posting this.  I sat with AIDS patients back when it was blieved you could catch it from holding someone's hand. He was an amazing guy and so was the archbishop. Welcome home.

@ericcolsen @katiecouric My heart still aches after all these years and I know the pain is endless for his parents.  20 years ago my son came out and my 1st reaction was fear because this young man had lost his life...for no reason.  😥
@ericcolsen @katiecouric This was a barbaric tragedy, especially to someone so https://t.co/V2c9yqAyw5
@ericcolsen @katiecouric This is heartbreaking. Why cant people just be left to be themselves?

@ericcolsen @katiecouric R.I.P. dear Matthew, for your life was taken far too soon by this senseless tragedy 😭 I was 18 years old when this happened and I remember how I felt for myself, for Matthew and his parents. Rest in Power, Matthew.
@ericcolsen @katiecouric It’s an unfortunately scary place out there. This kind of thing breaks my heard and terrifies me everyday
